TopicTitle: NASA's Kepler Mission Confirms First Planet in Habitable Zone of Sun-like Star

Articles.Content:
NASA\'s Kepler mission has confirmed its first planet in the 'habitable zone,' the region where liquid water could exist on a planetâ€™s surface. Kepler also has discovered more than 1,000 new planet candidates, nearly doubling its previously known count. Ten of these candidates are near-Earth-size and orbit in the habitable zone of their host star.

Source: http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/kepler/news/kepscicon-briefing.html

NEWS FLASH:

A company by the name Keebler are filing a major lawsuit towards the space corporation for using a copyrighted brand name on a planet! More details on this interplanetary snack scandal at 11!
I don\'t think copyright extends past the Earth\'s atmosphere. So you\'re welcome to name it Darth Vader and even LucasLaw can\'t touch you.
Besides, most companies would kill to have an entire *planet* named after them. It\'s free product placement and a big one at that.
